intro: Poecilochroma sodiroi, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hard seeds.
